title: Gilbert Strang: Linear Algebra, Teaching, and MIT OpenCourseWare | Lex Fridman Podcast #52

Well, yeah, I didn't give the theorem.

So that's the theorem.

So rotation, stretch, rotation is the breakup of any matrix.
The structure of that, the ability that you can do that, what do you find appealing?
What do you find beautiful about it?
Well, geometrically, as I freely admit, the action of a matrix is not so easy to visualize, but everybody can visualize a rotation.

Take three dimensional space.

It's pretty neat.
